boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team – Dice Set
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:

Crush everything to win with this Team Norse Dice Set, decorated with icy blue twists and golden dots. Each six-sided die in this set includes the Team Norse dragon ship logo on the 6 side, so you can buy your beer-loving teammates a round.
This set contains all the dice needed to play.

It includes:
3x Blood Bowl Blocking Dice
2x 6-sided dice with the Team Nordic logo on the 6 side
1x 8-sided Ricochet Blood Bowl dice
1x 16-sided dice

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season): Spike! Journal #14
boardgame.description:
This issue’s Guest Editor Harold Haroldson descends from the frigid north to bring a Spike! Journal filled with boozy boars and some icy slip-’n’-slide gameplay. That’s right, this issue brings the Norse Team to your games of Blood Bowl!
This journal covers the history, rules, and rosters of the Norse team. Alongside tales of booze, bone-breaking tackles, and a few incidents of accidentally freezing to death, you'll find the fantastic fun and essential commentary you've come to expect from Spike! Journal. As such, this magazine is the perfect companion for any cold-loving coach.

It includes:
As Cold as Ice: background on the origins of Norscan teams in Blood Bowl and how they play on the pitch. Includes information on their team positions, star players, and a team roster.

Famous Norse Teams: descriptions and background on some of the more famous Norse teams, including the Arctic Cragspiders, Vynheim Valkyries, New Fjord Jötnar, and the Skjårlsberg Icicles.

Norsca Rampagers Team Spotlight: an in-depth article focusing on the Norsca Rampagers, one of the most famous and successful Norse teams ever to grace the Blood Bowl pitch. Includes details of their history, team profile and colours, honours, Spike! team rating, as well as the roster of their famous 2497-2498 squad, and loads more.
Star Player – Ivar Eriksson: a profile on the renowned Blitzer known as 'The War Raider', the famed Norsca Rampagers player who signed with the team at the tender age of 16. Since first being given the opportunity to play, Ivar captured the heart of the crowd, eventually becoming Captain after a mid-match brawl with his predecessor.

Dirt from the Dugout: this time Mindy Piewhistle delves into the accusations that the up-and-coming Berserker, Bjor Hakonsson, may not be the champion drinker he claims.
Star Player – Skrorg Snowpelt: a profile on the famous Yhetee, Skrorg. After butchering most of his teammates, he was swiftly sacked and sent to Rockbeard's Rage Rehab, but emerged a changed beast! His improved attitude has made Skrorg a huge fan favourite, as a furry showman who plays to the crowd.

Northern Leagues: brand new rules and advice for running Northern Leagues – a variant on the standard Blood Bowl league season, allowing players to compete in the Icebowl – open to all teams with the usual budget of 1,000,000 gold pieces – for the coveted Icebowl Chalice. Also includes a unique Harsh Tundra Weather Table and a Norsca Kick-off Table, both of which you can use by rolling 2D6.

Coffin Corner: Spike! Journal's obituaries column commemorating those players who are no longer with us, whether trampled on the pitch, torn apart, or possibly eaten.
Frozen Lake Blood Bowl Pitch: includes rules for using the Frozen Lake Blood Bowl Pitch in your games, including special rules for Frozen Surface and Fragmented Surface. These rules are also included with the Norse Team – Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts Set.

Chat with the Rat: ace Skaven reporter Hackspit ‘the Scribbler’ Quillchewer meets with Fjörgskeg Raiders head coach Jarl Stelken Mikaelsson to talk about their claims of being the most decorated Norse team in history, and how they built up their impressive trophy collection.

Norse Balls: includes background and rules for 2 unique Norse Balls – the Hammer of Legend Ball and the Runestone Ball.
The Norscan Way: a detailed introduction to coaching Norse teams. Includes an overview of the strengths of their team, positions, tactics, and more.

Star Player – Thorsson Stoutmead: a profile on the beer-barrel-bowling bombardier, detailing how Thorsson first decided to use a barrel as a weapon, his drinking problem, and the book he published.
Dungeon Bowl Update: Norse Teams: provides a narrative and rules update for players to use their Norse Team miniatures in games of Dungeon Bowl.

Mighty Blow! – Free Beer: a look back on some of the tall tales from the career of Bob Bifford. Includes a comic strip in which Bob Bifford reminisces about the Norscans.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: The Last Hundred Yards Volume 4: The Russian Front
boardgame.description:
The Last Hundred Yards Vol. IV: The Russian Front is the fourth game in The Last Hundred Yards series. It covers major campaigns and missions from the second half of the war in the east, introducing the Russian army to the series for the first time. A series of missions simulates actions from the October 1943 fighting in the Ukraine near Krivoi Rog, while others feature fights during the Russian 1944 summer offensive, Operation Bagration. All major Russian armor from late 1942 onward is covered, plus some additional late war German armored vehicles.

The unique feature of this module is how Russian army behavior is modeled at the tactical level, particularly in its lack of local command-and-control flexibility and general indifference to casualties when fulfilling its missions. Make no mistake, playing the Russians will require a different mindset. The challenge will be in understanding the Russian behavior modeled in LHY and transitioning that into solid tactical applications. The Russians need numbers to make up for their lower tactical flexibility, but "quantity has a quality all its own,” and they generally do get those numbers. While the period of the war covered by the module was one of overall Russian initiative, it still featured numerous German counterattacks, and module missions feature plenty of German attacks against Russian defenses as well as the reverse. Another set of new tactical challenges in the module stem from the frequently more open terrain found in the western Ukraine.

The Last Hundred Yards (Base Game) and Volume II (Airborne Over Europe) are core volumes for the rest of the European LHY series. Thus, players must own both Volumes I and II to play the Russian Module, Mission Pack 1, and future modules in the series.

Game Components

8 double-sided geomorphic maps
1 9/16” counter sheet
2 ½ 3/4” counter sheets
1 full-color Rules booklet
1 full-color Playbook
8 Missions Cards (15 Missions)
2 Combat/Terrain Charts
1 Game Turn Track
4 Dice

—description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Last Hundred Yards Volume 2: Airborne Over Europe

boardgame.name: The Trash Pack: Dash for Trash
boardgame.description: Race your Trashie around Trash Town visiting the Recycle Ranch, Grot Lot and Compost Island. Collect a Trashie token at each of these locations before making a dash to the Junk Food Restaurant for one more Trashie token. Be the first player to collect one of each kind of Trash and to reach the Finish space to claim victory.

boardgame.name: Death Temple Sztun
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Offered as part of the Feretory Kickstarter campaign, this brief pamphlet offers, in the words of the publisher, a "hyper-linear murder gauntlet of a dungeon crawl."

boardgame.name: Chess Openings: Essential Pack
boardgame.description:
Chess Openings Memory Game is the first ever memory game that introduces and teaches chess openings. It is a game that brings together memory skills and chess knowledge.

Created by a chess enthusiast during his pursuit for better and more interesting ways to improve his chess skills. This game contains all you need to start your exploration.

The goal of the game is to match a chess opening title to how the opening presents on a chess board. The player that has the most pairs wins.

Included with the game is a booklet that contains all the chess openings moves and a simple breakdown about its strategies.

boardgame.name: Flipuzzles
boardgame.description:
Flipuzzles is a series of 1-card puzzles, which can be played in hand with no additional components. The puzzles come in a variety of themes, and each puzzle type has a unique Flip & Move mechanism that is used to move around the two sides of the card and solve the puzzle.

Each puzzle type uses a different Flip & Move mechanism to move around the card. Read the individual game rules to learn how to play.

Most puzzles can be solved through trial and error. After finding a solution, play again to see if you can complete it without making an error. Many puzzle types can be rotated without changing the gameplay. Try solving the same puzzle with the card in a different orientation.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rogue Handler
boardgame.description:
This supplement makes solo roleplaying most d100 Modern Setting Cthulhu Mythos games a real possibility. These rules add a simple yes-no oracle, for answering questions, along with a set of guidelines for evolving mysteries to be solved as you play. This as-you-play method means that you will not know what is going on until your Agent learns the truth for themselves. It is an excellent companion to quickstart your way into modern day Mythos games.

In addition to the oracle and mission generators, these rules add countdown clocks to add tension to your scenes and uses any sourcebooks, rulebooks, or fiction that you want to use as a source of clues, flavor content, and to answer questions that do not fit into a yes-no format or are not covered by the tables provided. You roll for a random page (d100), then paragraph (d6), and then sentence (d6), do that a couple of times, and then pick out the words that seem to fit your situation, and play style.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Explore the Forest
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Explore the Forest is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes some metal and magnetized parts. Some parts have LED circuitry (switch, battery, and socket) to support LED lighting attachments. This item was initially available as a pledge level during the Wildlands Kickstarter. The item comes in both painted and unpainted versions.

Explore the Forest comes with these 58 pieces:
(4) Forest Patchy Ground 12x12 (w/grid)
(2) Saluting Seraph (Pole Accessory)

boardgame.name: Dumpster Fire Party!
boardgame.description:
Dumpster Fire Party! is a storytelling game in which you and your friends share the absurd, embarrassing, and hilarious stories that make us want to chuck our whole life in the dumpster and set it ablaze.

Grab your friends, pick a theme, then kick back and listen to everybody describe one personal nightmare after another. The person with the best (or worst) stories wins!

You'll be surprised at how terrible your lives really are!

—description from the publisher

Some parts have LED circuitry (switch, battery, and socket) to support LED lighting attachments. This item was initially available as a pledge level during the Wildlands Kickstarter. The item comes in both painted and unpainted versions.

boardgame.description:

Explore the Swamp is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes some metal and magnetized parts. Some parts have LED circuitry (switch, battery, and socket) to support LED lighting attachments. This item was initially available as a pledge level during the Wildlands Kickstarter. boardgame.name: Card Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Card Fantasy(ASHCAN) is a quick ttrpg that's meant to be a one shot, short campaign or a filler between campaigns or games while the game runner plans out materials.

Card Fantasy offers a simple toolkit for playing any type of fantasy game. Using cards instead of dice for quick play and smooth action.

What is an ashcan edition? This is an early release version we want to add more to and the funds we make will help us add to the game. We plan to add audio files with someone reading the book. We will also rewrite the rules to be newer gamer friendly. We also plan to add more art work too.

boardgame.name: 時間線：台灣近代史 (Timeline: Taiwan)
boardgame.description:
Timeline: Taiwan (時間線:臺灣近代史) features in various history events in Taiwan.

When the Taiwan Railway General Administration of Commerce was established, was the first telegraph line in Taiwan connected? Was the Bank of Taiwan officially open at that time? When did the first order of Taiwanese tea to the United States begin?

The first player to sort all cards correctly wins. Combining games with other series of "Timeline" will have more fun and even greater challenges!

boardgame.name: Doomlings Blackbox Bundle
boardgame.description:
The Doomling Blackbox Bundle include:


Copy of the base Doomlings game
Two Mystery Holofoil Dominant Traits
Dinolings Expansion
Mythlings Expansion
Dual-Color Cards
Kickstarter Exclusive Blackbox
1 Motley Dominant card
Additional Kickstarter Exclusive cards

boardgame.name: Entities
boardgame.description:
Entities is a 2-in-1 board game including the best of cooperative, competitive, and single player modes in a world where the chances of survival are slim to none. Adversaries from different parts of this plane will have the mission to save their own lives only by facing the Entities: beings created by the Demiurge with the sole purpose of destroying the human race and giving rise to a new world.

Four contenders heeded the call of the mysterious Demiurge, who summoned them to the Magnetic Mount to be the only survivors of their era, but there will be only one conquering the Mount.

In order to reach the exit, you must complete your Quest Board and get three Treasures from the Entities you defeat. But not so fast! You must cross the Portal with enough energy to defeat Greiden, Guardian of the Path, so you will have to get the necessary equipment and experience from the Blue and Red decks.

Along the way, you have to watch out for the Demiurge, who will be constantly attacking the area and you will have to be cunning to avoid him between the enemy attacks and Entities hunting.

If your strength falters you can head to the Vimana, the Ship of the Gods, which will give you a chance to face the Demiurge in the Real Side, where you can win a bonus if you manage to beat him.

Earn the favor of the Demiurge by mercilessly destroying your opponents in Competitive mode, or try your luck tricking a deity in Co-op. For those days when you feel omnipotent, you can take the lonely road to face the demiurge in Single Player.

Many paths, only one option. Escape from the planet.

Meet the other side and find the truth.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Plastic Token Bundle
boardgame.description:
55 sturdy color-based Tokens so you won’t have to search for a specific Villain or Hero to put on the HP Track.

- Durability: not the same wear and tear that you see on the cardboard tokens;
- Set-up times improved: search only for the color of the Villain, or of your Hero's Combat Role, and you're good to go;
- Visibility: with different shapes, it is easier to distinguish different Teams on the HP Track when both have a Hero of the same Combat Role.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Scenario Pack
boardgame.description:
Pedestals/Artifacts replace tokens with valuable (and varied) use in quests from Tanares Adventures. They can also be obstacles in a battlefield or be placed next to vertices of an altar tile for aesthetic effect. | Tombstones mark the square of death of a character, an important tracker for Tanares Adventures’ new mission rules and in Team deathmatches if one of the Heroes can revive others (to mark the target square of the spell) | Malign Towers track an important status in Tanares Adventures’ quests — the Fatigue, through which it is marked that a Hero cannot act until the next round begins | Portals and barricades replace cardboard tiles with gameplay significance both in PvP and in PvE game modes, as they change the dynamics of combat.

- Pedestals/Artifacts x4 (base: 1 square inch. 1x Grappling hook/rope, 1x Elder Tome/book, 1x Key, 1x Torch)
- Hurdle x4 (base: 2 square inches — 2x1)
- Tombstone x4 (base: 1 square inch)
- Square barricade (base: 4 square inches — 2x2)
- Malign Tower x4 (base: 1 square inch)
- Palisade x2 (base: 4 square inches — 4x1)
- Portal x4 (base: 4 square inches — 2x2)
- Bulwark x2 (base: 8 square inches — 4x2)

boardgame.name: Ultimate NPCs: Skullduggery (Pathfinder)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The rooms are warm(ish), and the rates are low (almost suspiciously so), just don't ask what's in the pies and don't expect to have all your valuables come morning.

A tool for Games Masters and Players alike, Ultimate NPCs: Skulduggery is a collection of fully fleshed-out characters to populate your game world. Occupying the seedy tap-houses and criminal underbelly of civilization, you'll find a variety of thieves, assassins and mercenaries within, each with the backstory and statistics necessary to run as an NPC or player character.

So pull up a stool, try the ale (don't mind the lumps), and meet the regulars...

boardgame.name: Jeździectwo: konkurs skoków przez przeszkody
boardgame.description:
The rules of the game are similar to a horse jumping competition.
A player has to go trougth the course without single mistakes. He is allowed tp rpll a dice 17 time during a game. Player gets 1 penalty point when he throws a dice over that limit (the norm of time). Moreover, when a player places his horse (pawn) on the obstacle he gets penalty points too. The person with the lowest number of penalty points wins.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Fundacja dla Dzieci Chorych na Białaczkę i Choroby Nowotworowe "Krwinka"

boardgame.name: Cards of the Dead: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Cards of the Dead: The Board Game is an adaptation of the “Cards of the Dead” video game.

A survival game for 1-3 players in a city infested by Zombies.

The game offers an experience that differs from the video game, and can be played both solo and with multiple players.

In Cards of the Dead: The Board Game players must take control of one of the Survivors and make it out of the city alive over the course of three days.

Players are advised to explore the interiors of places like the Supermarket where they will need to stock up with equipment and resources in order to remain alive throughout the game.

At the same time, they will need to contain the Zombies who infest the city and its vicinity, before being surrounded and falling prey to their incessant hunger…

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Advent Horizon
boardgame.description:
Advent Horizon is the definitive Science Fiction role playing game featuring 11 new classes, 9 races, and dozens of new skills. Fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game, Advent Horizon includes Open Gaming License rules for ships, vehicle combat, modern weapons, and more. In addition to 11 completely new, completely original Classes, Advent Horizon features a complete skill system design to allow you to feature and customize your character as you see fit. Your class only serves as a framework for you to customize your skills and abilities.

At over 240 pages the Core Rulebook includes everything you need to play in the Arc, or create your own futuristic setting.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Metal Coin Set
boardgame.description: 50 metal coins

boardgame.name: The Sands of Despair (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Recent seismic events unearth a long buried tomb in the desert, and the locals fear that a long dead tyrant's last words may come true...

The Sands of Despair is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game V1 side trek for 6th level characters, designed to be completed in a single session (more or less). This adventure could be run in a single session, maybe more depending on how much the players interact with the environment.

The adventure is set inside a mummy's tomb and contains at most three major traps/hards and four encounters, culminating in meeting Iryk-Tep, Mummy Lord of Mejdul.

It is setting agnostic and can be used in almost any campaign setting or environment.

boardgame.name: A Seafarer's Favor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A trader from a small port on the Can Sea asks the party to help protect a ship transporting goods to a nearby dockyard. The gig appears easy enough, but an ulterior motive hides behind the request. The veiled mention of precious cargo may not be what the adventurers would expect… or hope… to deliver.

A Seafarer’s Favor is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 9th-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Drops of Juniper
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The rainy season has come to the Basserain Fields in southern Tres, a welcome time for the local farmers. This includes the Dakuri Manor, famous for their juniper brandy, known to those that frequent the taverns of the region as Gold Leaf Brandy. Also with the arrival of the rains, the peculiar lady from the overgrown hills makes her yearly visit to Alutum Banshiir. But this year, she was chased out before making any purchases. Days after, one of the Dakuri fields became riddled with a voracious caterpillar, threatening to plague their entire crop. Things have become desperate.

Drops of Juniper is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 10th-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Denizens of the Crystal Isthmus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Twas many years ago when two continents became one. We know not how it came to be, but when our ancestors first climbed out of their shelters, it simply was — a titanic bridge of crystal extending beyond the horizon. Twisted plants grew out of its core and strange creatures prowled in its many ravines. We have lived here ever since."

The Crystal Isthmus is a mysterious, magically-rich region in the world of Elanor, but it can be used as a location in any fantasy world. This supplement contains a plethora of content to inspire adventure upon the isthmus.

Chapter 1, “Crystalline Ecology”, explores the ecosystem of the Isthmus. This chapter describes supernatural phenomena, crystals that can store magical energy, and seven native beasts.

Chapter 2, “The Brightstone Clan”, introduces the factions residing upon the isthmus, including a clan of surface dwarves that carve crystals to create music and a cult that promises an escape from one's dark past. Aside from lore and seven original creatures, this chapter includes rules for goat chariot racing.

Chapter 3, “Ruins of Golcrassar”, sheds light on the ruined merfolk city at the center of the isthmus and the terrible curse that still afflicts it. This chapter includes a stat block for Dalkiri, a tyrannical wraith who commands her ghostly subjects to extinguish the life of whoever dares enter her realm.

boardgame.name: Doctor Diomedes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What an excellent day for an exorcism! Doctor Diomedes is one of the most successful and popular exorcists in all of Zul. The wealthy and powerful seek him out to rid their loved ones of hostile spiritual possession—but he has a secret that only his half-orc partner in the healing arts knows about. And with a bounty on his head, there'll be Hell to pay when Doctor Diomedes comes to Vadashar.

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, plus character descriptions, an essay about medicine, healing, and the supernatural causes of illness, the mechanics of demon possession and exorcism in the World of Zul, adventure hooks, NPC stat blocks, and advice for incorporating Doctor Diomedes into your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Argent Affair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You get a message from a contact you trust that someone with deep pockets is putting together a crew for a 211. Your contact immediately thought of you for the job. The person putting together the crew has set the meeting for tomorrow night at a local dive bar . Sounds pretty straight forward. What could possibly go wrong?

The Argent Affair is a short heist adventure that can be run with or without supernatural elements and is set in modern day. Included are 8 1/2" x 11" copies of Argent National Bank and Cassablanca Mansion floorplans from Fabled Environments.

boardgame.name: Pit of Unquiet Souls (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saare’s Pit has another, more lurid, name—and for good reason. The Pit of Unquiet Souls squats at the centre of a nest of macabre tales of madness, horror and death. It is said, those who spend too much time in the abandoned mine often go mad or disappear entirely, and old miners’ tales tell of the pit’s very rocks whispering horrible secrets to those toiling in its bowels. Still, there are those who think treasure yet lurks in the mine and will brave its terrors to retrieve them.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Ashlar campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Arm-Gunn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From survivors, you’ve heard stories of these brutes. Of their rock spitting lower arms and terrible jaws. You’re aware of their bloodthirsty nature, tendency to form ranks with skullocks, moaners and other savage muties to annihilate entire villages, but nothing prepared you for this.

You now stand at the edge of their territory, and after tracking the pack of arm-gunn marauders, you and your team have come to the end of the line. Up on that mound... are those people on those rebar shafts and wooden stakes? And... what’s that next to those skulls? An assault rifle just hanging on a pipe?

Aptly named for their lower set of rock spitting, cannon like limbs, arm-gunns are powerfully built, exceptionally cruel and territorial humanoids. These mutants dwell in ruins, inhospitable wastelands, rugged forests and stinking swamps. Besides their ferocious nature and tendency to savour the kill, they make use of trophy poles to mark the boundaries of their turf. Clusters of these poles are set on mounds and rubble heaps for all to see, and sometimes accompanied by valuable relics and still living captives. Experienced excavators and scavengers know what this means, and approach such grisly displays with extreme caution.

This is our 15th Monday Mutant release and the 3rd in our follow-up dozen for the Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. Like the last one, this is an expanded creature listing running at 8 pages and includes a few graphite drawings along with a random 1d12 mutation table and extensive 2d20 random discoveries table for some of the things diggers might find among a collection of trophy poles.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Living Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Temple of the Living Earth is a 3-5 session (or about 12-20 hours, depending on roleplay and combat duration) adventure for 5 7th- or 8th-level characters that takes the adventurers to a volcanic temple where they must put a stop to a powerful necromancer monk's plans to corrupt the spirit of the volcano and create an army of magma core undead.

This 17-page PDF contains all the information you need to run the adventure, including two new monsters including a unique NPC, an undead monster template with two examples, and several encounters.

boardgame.name: Faerie Bargains (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be Careful What You Wish For!

The magic and mystery of the fey is on display in Faerie Bargains! From Rumpelstiltskin to Rapunzel, fairy tales, myths, and legends all over the world are replete with tales of bargains struck with the sublime and sometimes sinister magical creatures from the realms beyond. Long life, wealth beyond imagining, true love, or whatever your heart’s desire all wrapped up in a promise and a price that seems but a trifle, until the bargain comes due and the fair folk come to collect. Faerie Bargains provides you a richly detailed system for using this classic fantasy trope in your Pathfinder Second Edition campaign. You can design your own faerie bargains or use one of the over 40 sample bargains provided, from bounty of the wilds and unseen assistants to woven wealth, silent metamorphosis, fey queen’s ransom, and one with the land! Each bargain grants a benefit once payment is made, of course, but you’ll also find rules for hidden conditions, escape clauses, tokens, and more, along with how to research and negotiate bargains with different kinds of fey and unique magical items you might obtain in a faerie bargain or make with fey assistance, like the cauldron of autumnal bounty and sword of vernal light. Whether your heroes want to trade their dreams for the charm of magic, a gift of blood for accursed mercy, or their sanity itself for inspired perfection, you’ll find an amazing array of mystical covenants that bring fantastic new flavor to the fey in your game!

boardgame.name: Gardeners
boardgame.description:
Gardeners is a simultaneous cooperative game played silently and in real time.

In less than 15 minutes, players must succeed in arranging as many gardens as possible, always composed of the same 36 tiles, but responding to different rules from one round to another.
Everyone must deduce the rules in force by observing where the tiles are placed and from where some are removed.

A game of Gardeners is made up of an indefinite number of rounds. Each is broken down into 5 phases, as follows:


Draw a Constraint card,
Start the sandtimer,
Arrange the garden,
Check the garden,
Prepare for the next round.


During the game, players cannot communicate in any way about what to do or not to do to make the garden.

Will you satisfy the King's whimsical desires?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pearladöra
Perladöra
boardgame.description:
Pearladöra is a competitive bluff game. It can also be played as teams. It's a new theme and new version of the game Armadöra.

Each player chooses a Clan at the beginning of the game. They all have a unique special power to help you.

You will have to collect more pearls than your opponents. To do so, you will have to create separated areas with your pontoons and place your divers so as to get the majority.

Every turn, the question is simple: Will you either place a diver face down, or 2 pontoons? But be cautious, because in your answer lies strong consequences on the game.
Try to anticipate, to block your opponent without getting excluded of an area you seek, to read in your opponent's game, to bluff… And maybe then, you'll be able to win the most beautiful pearl collection!

This game is competitive when played by 2 or 3 players. It becomes a team competition when played by 4 players.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: In der Unterwelt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seit mittlerweile 63 Jahren wird das Herzogtum Demetos im Auftrag des Königs von Syderland von einem Gouverneur verwaltet.

Damals starben die tyrannischen Zwillingsbrüder Kyriak und Paniotes während einer gemeinsamen Revolte der geknechteten Bevölkerung und weiten Teilen der herzoglichen Truppen, der sich letztlich sogar die Garde anschloss.

Kyriak herrschte als Herzog über das Land, während sein zwei Minuten jüngerer Bruder Paniotes als Hohepriester die religiöse Gewalt ausübte.

Da es nach ihrem gewaltsamen Tod keine legitimen Erben gab, fiel das Herzogtum an die Krone zurück.

Seit einiger Zeit mehren sich jedoch die Anzeichen, dass die damaligen dramatischen Ereignisse immer noch nicht ausgestanden sind.

Der amtierende Hohepriester Arastarchos glaubt, dass einer der beiden Brüder aus dem Totenreich zurückgekehrt ist.

Und alles deutet darauf hin, dass dieser weiterhin mit seinem im Totenreich zurückgebliebenen Bruder in Verbindung steht.

Arastarchos ist davon überzeugt, dass jemand in die Unterwelt hinabsteigen muss, um die Gefahr endgültig zu bannen.

Doch soweit bekannt, ist bisher noch nie ein Lebender von dort zurückgekehrt.

boardgame.name: High School Princess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High School Princess is a game of social dynamics and best friends.

In this game, you all play members of a clique of girls in high school. There's a queen bee, her best friend, her minions and of course, the one who's on the lowest rung of the social ladder. Navigate complex social expectations, double talk and what friendship really means in this game where you can choose to bend to the will of your friends, strike out on your own or try and climb the ladder to become the queen yourself.

Think Heathers, Clueless, Mean Girls and Easy A where the violence isn't in the actual exchange of blows, it's in words, especially the ones spoken behind someone's back.

boardgame.name: Cliffside Griffon Hatchery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Built high into a cliff, an elevator leads up to this griffon hatchery. Caves have been carved out and turned into nests, next to a fresh watering hole. Further in the hatchery are rooms for the keepers of the griffons, who live and work alongside the animals they breed.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring an angry noble attempting to steal an egg, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: reSISTERs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This game doesn't pretend to accurately represent the experience of fantifas militants. Its rudimentary comment - that there's a contradiction to be overcome between office and street activism - mostly intends to reveal our representations.

boardgame.name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol III
boardgame.description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol III (Blue Cross, White Ensign) is an official expansion to Blue Cross, White Ensign by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 231 individually named ships included with Blue Cross, White Ensign. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Blue Cross, White Ensign. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Blue Cross, White Ensign. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the British, French, and American fleets. There are insufficient Spanish, Venetian, and East India Company ships to form a fleet, but these ships can be included in the fleets of the other nationalities as desired or added to the cards from the first volume of Beat to Quarters.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Blue Cross, White Ensign!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Eye of Erendor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Eye of Erendor is a rules-lite RPG for playing old-school-influenced, fiction-first fantasy adventures. Delve into deeply haunted ruins, explore the expanding empires, fight demons or don't, the choices are all yours! Be careful, though. The realms aren't as unforgiving as they are vast and strange...

Adding and subtracting rules to taste is expected and even encouraged, but not required.

boardgame.name: I am the Blue Mage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you the mage with the most powerful magic? Let's find out.

This is an abstract table-top RPG. You are a mage able to bend time, space, words, and reason, trying to seize control of the universe. For those in love with chaos magic and banter.

What do I need to play?
A mouth, a brain, and some friends to play with. No set-up or preparation required.

Can I win?
Unlike most RPGs, yes — by thinking creatively and outsmarting your friends. Simple as that. ;)

Are you sure this game is an RPG? There's no character creation, no dice, no GM...
It's an abstract RPG. It's less of a linear narrative and more of a thought experiment.

boardgame.name: I am the Witch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I am the Witch is a hack of I am the Blue Mage, only less abstract, more in the flesh. You [roleplay] the whole reunion of witches gossiping and wishing and competing for the Crown.

The heart of the game is formal duels, which you can paint as the Madame Mim vs Merlin anthology scene, Sun Wu Kong encounters or Magic: The Gathering if that's your fancy.

boardgame.name: Nimalia
boardgame.description:
Design the best Animal Sanctuary while playing 5 rounds.

Each round, you'll have to draw 3 cards, place one, and pass along the others (simple drafting phase). Each card is composed of 4 biomes, each one of them containing an animal. When you place a card, you have to cover AT LEAST one biome. Thus, the whole Sanctuary must fit in a 6 by 6.

Each game will have a different pool of various objectives. Each round will count only some of the objectives chosen for the game. So you'll have to modify your sanctuary during all the game so as to score points according to the ongoing objectives.

At the end of the 5 rounds, the player who earned the more points becomes the winner!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Waves of the Kept Stone
boardgame.description:
From the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep adventure design contest!

From the publishers blurb:

“Fear arrives on the waves as the terrifying tower, the Sea’s Stone, unleashes a tide of lizardmen upon the unsuspecting coasts.”

boardgame.name: All Hail The Necrotoad and Fifteen Fungi on the Dead Man's Chest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This third-party publication contains two nasty mobile dungeons, each meant to cover one session of play, including encounters, treasures, maps, custom illustrations, and evil bosses, for the RPG Mörk Borg. Digital download includes the adventure as both pages and spreads.

In All Hail the Necrotoad, three hags terrorize the countryside from their mansion inside a giant undead toad. Do you dare to pay them a visit?

In Fifteen Fungi on the Dead Man’s Chest, an alien fungus has infected a crew and their captain, using their ship to spread the infection to coastal villages nearby. Can you stop it before it is too late?

boardgame.name: Pit of Unquiet Souls (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saare’s Pit has another, more lurid, name—and for good reason. The Pit of Unquiet Souls squats at the centre of a nest of macabre tales of madness, horror and death. It is said, those who spend too much time in the abandoned mine often go mad or disappear entirely, and old miners’ tales tell of the pit’s very rocks whispering horrible secrets to those toiling in its bowels. Still, there are those who think treasure yet lurks in the mine and will brave its terrors to retrieve them.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Anunnaki: Dawn of the Gods – 20 Mana Crystal Gems
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter exclusive:
A special set of 20 Mana Crystal Gems made with an exclusive material.

boardgame.name: Busy Beaks
boardgame.description:
Get to know Australia's most fascinating birds in Busy Beaks.

In the game, each player collects bird cards and gathers them into flocks to score points. Whoever makes the most valuable flocks wins! Each bird also has a special ability, like the Powerful Owl who lets you search the deck for the card you really need, or the mimicking Magpie who lets you copy another card. Choose which birds you want to use each game to make every play feel different.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Scribbly Gum
boardgame.description:
Did you know Australia's scribbly gum trees get their beautiful scribbles from baby moths burrowing through the bark?

In Scribbly Gum, each player has their own tree diagram and every turn gets to draw a line that leads to food for your baby moth to eat. Collect sets of food to score points. Whoever scribbles their way to the most valuable food wins!

Scribbly Gum can be played with any number of players at once and includes directions for classroom play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pass the Party Food
boardgame.description:
Throwback to 1989 and dig in to your all-time favorite party food! There's fairy bread, lamingtons, green snakes, and more.

Working together in Pass the Party Food, players need to collect their favorite treats and share them with their friends at the right time — but watch out because Ziggy, the mischievous puppy, is trying to grab food off the table! If you can outscore him as a team, you will all win the game together.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Card sleeves
boardgame.description: 50 Card Sleeves that will fit both your One Night, Werewords, and Werebeasts tiles perfectly! Printed on one side to cover any marks you might have accidentally made on them, these card sleeves will protect your tiles from damage! Also designed to make them easy to pick up (the "seam" in the middle of the edge, provides a small area for gripping with your fingers). Compatible with One Night, Daybreak, Vampire, Alien, Super Villain, Bonus Pack 1, Bonus Pack 2, Bonus Pack 3, Bonus Pack 4, Werewords, and Werebeasts tiles.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Bonus Pack 1
One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Bonus Pack 2
One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Bonus Pack 3

boardgame.name: HeroQuest 2021: Feldherr Inlay
boardgame.description: Feldherr foam trays and plastic token holder to sort and protect your miniatures and game material in the core game box.

boardgame.name: LOWBORN: Zweihander RPG Fanzine (Issue 5)
boardgame.description:
This issue offers:


Alternative Character Creation
Twenty new Talents
New Ancestry: Awakened Undead
SEAMAN Generating NPCs
Improvising NPCs
Perilous Tactics: Bog Behemoth Misery and Company
Perusing the Ivory Archive: More Magick

boardgame.name: HeroQuest 2021: Feldherr Inlay Core Game + Kellars Keep + Return of the Witch Lord
boardgame.description: Foam set for the core game and the two expansions "Kellar's Keep" and "Return of the Witch Lord" - Fits into the original core game box.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: HeroQuest: Return of the Witch Lord

boardgame.name: HeroQuest: Return of the Witch Lord 2021 – Feldherr Inlay
boardgame.description: Foam set incl. plastic card holder to store all contents of the expansion "The Return of the Witch Lord" for HeroQuest (2021).
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: HeroQuest: Return of the Witch Lord

boardgame.name: HeroQuest: Kellar's Keep 2021 – Feldherr Inlay
boardgame.description: Foam set including plastic token and card holder to store all contents of the expansion "Kellar's Keep".

boardgame.name: LOWBORN: Zweihander RPG Fanzine (Issue 6)
boardgame.description:
This issue offers:


Adventure 1 - Caves of Flame
Adventure 2 - Doom-Dealer's Party
Easy Campaigns - For the Company
Perilous Tactics: High-Flying Harpies
New Monster- Glass Golem

boardgame.name: LOWBORN: Zweihander RPG Fanzine (Issue 7)
boardgame.description:
This issue offers:


Rumors of the Undead
The Troubles in Roseburg
Those Two Orx
Sol Invictus’ Holy Armament

boardgame.name: LOWBORN: Zweihander RPG Fanzine (Issue 8)
boardgame.description:
This issue offers:


New Slain! Descriptions
The Poachers of Thagwood
Those Two Orx
Sol Invictus’ Inquisition

boardgame.name: Rotation Rumble
boardgame.description:
In Rotation Rumble you take over the role of a guild coach, that hires and commands mercenaries in the weekly rumble fights for money, cheesecake and glory. Chose wisely which fighters, challenges and inventory you combine to form the best possible pack of reckless rumblers.

Rotation Rumble is played with a pre-constructed deck of squared cards, which have 4 different actions on each side (in rare cases there are just 2) which can be activated by rotating them.
This allows for endless combinations, possibilities and threats. Easy, isn’t it?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mark of the Mantis
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

The Red Mantis assassins are one of the most feared organizations on all of Golarion, for their reach is far and their methods effective. When several of Absalom’s councilors from the Petals District turn up dead, all evidence points to Red Mantis responsibility. However, the truth is that the sole surviving council, a secretive servant of the evil deity Norgorber, is responsible and now stands to be elected without opposition. The murderer masquerading as a Red Mantis assassin is one thing, but since the kills were so inexpertly done, the Red Mantis cannot allow the noble to live. Assigning several agents to the mission, the Red Mantis intend to infiltrate the noble’s manor and execute her for her slight against their order. With three Red Mantis assassins and one bitter mercenary on the job, the noble must die before the stroke of midnight.

This short Pathfinder (second edition) adventure written by John Compton is intended to be completed in a single session and includes four 6th-level pregenerated characters. Three of the characters have strong ties to the Red Mantis assassins and use rules options presented in Pathfinder Lost Omens: World Guide, while the fourth is a mercenary fighter out for revenge. This adventure can easily be incorporated into various virtual tabletops, run off of digital devices, or printed out and played at a table.

boardgame.name: Head-Shot the Rot
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb
Taking a much-needed relaxing break in between escapades, four gun-toting adventurers post up in a dingy bar in one of Alkenstar's entertainment districts. Right across the street at a theater, people flood inside to catch the premiere of a highly-advertised play, but what comes out of the theater is far more dangerous. As people scatter to safety in the dusty streets, its up to the group of gunslingers in the bar to set things right.

This short Pathfinder 2nd edition adventure written by Michael Sayre is intended to be completed in a single session and includes four 3rd-level pregenerated gunslinger characters, who make use of the exciting new equpment and rules found in Pathfinder Guns & Gears, whose backstories and motivations tie closely to one another. This adventure can be easily incorporated into various virtual tabletops, run off of digital devices, or printed out and played at a table.

boardgame.name: Thiefdom
boardgame.description:
In Thiefdom players represent competing thief guilds who rob from the rich medieval town called Bacharach to declare the most skillful thief guild. It is a strategic, interactive and thematic pickup & delivery game for 1-4 players who each control three thief figures and try to avoid the four city guards who try to bust any thief they run into.

The city guards are controlled by all players and they do limit how freely the thieves can move around the town. The thieves need to circumvent the city guards and may also skillfully use equipment like grapples, climbing tools or smoking bombs to avert detention. In case of a detention a thief figure loses all their loot and some victory points.

The game is played over 6 nights (rounds) and the player with the most victory points is declared the winner.

One night contains:

Planning Phase: All players simultaneously plan the order in which they want to move their three thief figures and the neutral figures they control that night (city guards, carriage, citizens). Then they reveal at the same time.
Action Phase (Night): The players make actions in the predefined order from the planning phase.
Administration Phase (Day): Cleanup and preparation for the next night


The town setup includes 8 modular and double-printed town quarters, resulting in a unique pickup & delivery puzzle in each game. There are 12 different equipments thieves can buy to gain new abilities and they can befriend 36 unique guest cards in the tavern to get unique support.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Rhodesian Railways
boardgame.description:
From Capetown to Salisbury, from Durban to Walvis Bay, the railroads of Africa spanned a continent of jungles, deserts, veldt, swamps and mountains. German SouthWestAfrica, Cape Colony, Orange Free State, Transvaal, Bechuanaland, Mozambique, Natal and Rhodesia are the scope of this luckless economic game where the most money at the end of the game wins.

Ports are crucial to start a railroad, penetrating the terrain is expensive & difficult. Business interests drive players inland in this game for 3-5 players for about one hour. Loans are taken for intensive capital investment, with the game ending when one player has expended all their cubes.

Historically, the Dutch, Portuguese, Germans and British drove the development of this region, each with varying success.

Rhodesian Railways is the third game using Winsome’s Regional Railways System. The prior two games were Balkan Railways and Iberian Railways.

boardgame.name: Goblin Goldrush
boardgame.description:
Goblin Goldrush - A game of tricks, traps, monsters and loot! 2-4 player party game to see which goblin can escape the dungeon with the most gold.

The goblins are on the loose in this frantic family board game! Simple to play and easy to learn, the kids will love this beautifully illustrated and whimsical game. The custom tile map system means every game is a unique experience!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zoomalia
boardgame.description:
The Zoomalia is a game to play with friends and the whole family.
​
Players will participate in two distinct phases to accumulate the most points. In the first phase, which consists of an Animal Auction, players will purchase animal cards that will be used in the next phase. In the second phase, players must collect the best combination of foods through the Food Market using the cards acquired in the first phase.

The player with the highest score will be the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arduin Monster Spotlight: Ibathene
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Even dragons flee when they hunt...

One of the bogeymen of the Arduin mythos is revealed for you today! Ibathne are uncaring, deadly predators that haunt areas, stripping them clean to barren ground. Luckily for us they are pretty rare!

These behemoths think nothing of munching on a brace of Wyverns or dinosaur for lunch and are too stupid to back down even when they tangle with something too much or too smart for them. The down side is they don't know when to quit: often fighting well after their death!

boardgame.name: Vem får sista ordet?
boardgame.description:
Vem får sista ordet? is a word game. Each round there will be two cards drawn, one with a letter and one with an category (eg. dishes). After that a timer is started, and all player in clockwise order gonna start say a word that fits the category and also that starts on the given letter. The player that has said the last word when the timers rings move that players pawn one step on the board. The first player that reach goal (takes 13 steps) is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Argent Adept – Dark Dynamics
boardgame.description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the Multiverse.

HP: 23

Power: Reveal the top card of any 2 decks. Put 1 card into play and the other into the trash.

boardgame.name: The Beautiful Game: A Turn-Based Strategy Boardgame
boardgame.description:
Step into the shoes of great football coaches and show off your managerial skills. You will be in charge of every move your team players make, whether an audacious attack or resolute defense. Test out different formations, based on those of famous football clubs, and find out which one best matches your play style. In 'The Beautiful Game', players will take turns positioning their players formations, as they tackle, pass, shoot and score, in order to break down the opposing player's defence.

Your turn (as the one with the football) consists of as many 'singular moves' as possible, plus one 'multi-move' based on your designated formation. Moving the ball carefully, you will seek to pass to your teammates and look for opportunities to shoot & score on the goal.

boardgame.name: Pharaoh
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In 1983, TSR published the module named “Pharoah” with the module code “I3” , I for Intermediate level adventures. It was written by Tracy and Laura Hickman, and illustrated by Jeff Easley, and Jim Holloway. It consisted of a 32 page booklet and two folding covers with maps. Pharaoh was the first module of a three module series that included I4 Oasis of the White Palm, and I5 Lost Tomb of Martek. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters and traps.

This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

To use this conversion guide you will need a copy of I3: Pharaoh.

boardgame.name: Facing the Titan
boardgame.description:
Facing the Titan is a GM-less, zero-prep roleplaying game, for one-shots games of about 3 hours. It has been designed and playtested for groups of 3 to 5 people. A solo mode is also available.

You will play the Compagny, a group of heroes whose fate is to face the colossal Titan. And to destroy it!

You will only need something to write with and on, and two dices: a white one and a black one. Based on Swords Without Master (by Epidiah Ravachol), the game system will get you to tell the journey of your Companion to the final clash against the Titan in a series of five distinct Phases.

You’ll find six basic Titans in the book. They’re all delivered with their own Setting, a tiny universe suited to them. Find out about:


Ménébraz, the Living Mountain
Vamakaskan, the Mother of the Herd
Lofituina, the Horror of the Depths
Satria, the Rusty Knight
Jahadoo, the Error of the Magi
Gureintinku, the Bronze Wing


Each one of these Titans will offer you an original adventure, replayable at will thanks to some random lists generating a new Setting at each game.

In addition to these six Titans, the crowdfunding campaign of Facing the Titan has made it possible to add articles about the game, to extend the way to play it, to modify it or event to create content like new Titans.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Iconoclasts
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

THE FATHER OF WAR UNLEASHED

Born of the U.S. government’s 1928 raid on the degenerate coastal town of Innsmouth, Massachusetts, the covert agency known as Delta Green opposes the forces of darkness with honor but without glory. Delta Green agents fight to save humanity from unnatural horrors—often at a shattering cost.

ICONOCLASTS brings a team of Agents to a scene of horrors all too real: Mosul in 2016, held by the self-styled Islamic State in a reign of depraved brutality. From a small base at the Kirkuk airfield, the Agents must research the horrors to come and prepare for a harrowing infiltration.


HORRORS IN MOSUL: A grim overview of life under ISIL.
A BLACK SMOKE RISING: A scenario as prelude. The players briefly take the roles of ISIL fighters, sent to destroy mysterious artifacts without knowing what terrors they might bring upon themselves.
OPERATION BONE BOX: Delta Green Task Force 01132 gathers for a briefing on a ghastly incursion and an interview with an unusual witness: a renegade veteran of Delta Green.
THE EVIL OF THE WHISPERER: Espionage, political wrangling, and pursuit of hidden myths of history and prehistory prepare the Agents for Mosul. But can any preparation be enough?
AMONG JINN AND MEN: Gore in the streets of Mosul and the waters of the Tigris. A bloodthirsty cult, its viciousness shocking even by the standards of ISIL. A demon or god rising to ancient glory.
BLACKER THAN BLACK: Extensive rules and guidelines for spying, crime, and backroom deals that can be the basis of an even broader international Delta Green campaign.
New rituals, new tomes, and the dreadful details of a threat to suit all the evils of humanity.


ICONOCLASTS is playable with DELTA GREEN: THE ROLE-PLAYING GAME, Arc Dream Publishing's award-winning game of cosmic horror and personal apocalypse.

boardgame.name: The Ruin 5e
boardgame.description:
The world fell and now you need to survive!

The Ruin is a dark and gritty Post Apocalyptic RPG using a D100 rule system, everything you need is inside this book.

The world of The Ruin was destroyed by an invasion from another dimension, creatures determined to terraform the Earth into a world they could live, but in order to save our planet, we almost destroyed it.

The Ruin is not a Zombie game but more a true apocalyptic experience, no mutants or even mutations just you against wild animals, gangs, raiders and disease, more akin to movies like the Book of Eli and The Road then The Walking Dead.

Within the game are:


7 classes to choose from
All rules for combat and vehicle combat
Gear and weapon tables
How to build a Settlement
4 City Guides
17 pages of threats
Encounter tables
Rules for surviving the wastes


So Grab your Scrap Gun and start exploring the wastes of The Ruin RPG.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Izirion's Enchiridion of the West Marches
boardgame.description:
Izirion’s Enchiridion of the West Marches contains everything you need to run your own West Marches game in Fifth Edition or an OSR system, or to create a grimy, player-driven wilderness sandbox suitable for any campaign.

"Here, at the end of the road, there lie uncharted wilds, where courage of heart and the spirit of discovery still ring true. Here, beyond the edge of the map, relentless peril may crush the soul of the unworthy, yet it shall stoke the embers of greatness. Here, amidst the ruin and brimstone, awaits the forge of heroes, where legends are tempered in fire and blood."

Welcome to the West Marches.

Izirion’s Enchiridion is a guide and toolbox for running your own games in the campaign style of the West Marches, designed to facilitate a large pool of players that create their own parties and plan their own missions to explore a sprawling, persistent wilderness. As they delve deeper into the Marches, they will uncover ancient mysteries, challenge mighty foes, and blaze the path that will determine their fate.

Inside, you will find rules for wilderness travel and exploration, toolkits for building your own regions and factions, and guidelines for writing and designing complex layers of history.

Izirion's Enchiridion is written with Fifth Edition in mind, but is easily compatible with most OSR systems (the book includes conversion guidelines).

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Book of Constructs
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Book of the Constructs! Inside this tome are the statistics and schematics for over 150 constructs. From a simple clockwork spy to the towering iron colossus, there is a construct for any situation.

Included in this book are combat tactics, creature templates, and crafting suggestions.

What mechanical monsters will you face or build on your journey?

Enjoy the Book of Constructs!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ancestry Awakened (5e)
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Ancestry Awakened! This book brings 40 brand new ancestry (racial) options to your 5th edition game and replaces the traditional race rules with amazing new features like:


A new way to choose and create ancestries with the Major/Minor Feature system! Now every character with the same ancestry can be different!
Rules and narrative information for playing traditionally “monstrous” creatures as balanced, fully fleshed out characters.
Overhauling the existing 5e ancestry options to fit within the feature system.


Enjoy a treasure trove of exciting new ancestry options for your game!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: COMBO TRAX
boardgame.description:
COMBO TRAX is a fighting game for 2 players using the mechanisms of a climbing game. Each player starts the game with 20 HP, and when a player passes, they will take damage based upon the last card(s) played by their opponent. They will also increase their power gauge.

Further, each player has special techniques that can be triggered depending upon the suits of the cards played, with the suits representing the buttons that would've been hit in an arcade game. Players may also be able to overlap the suits so as to make combos of their moves.

The first player to eliminate their opponent wins, or play best 2 out of 3.

boardgame.name: 死神プリスクール (Shinigami Preschool)
boardgame.description:
死神プリスクール (Shinigami Preschool) is a trick-taking game where the players take on the role of preschool teachers, gathering their students.

It is a "must-follow" game, but players can follow either the lead suit or the rank of the card. Players will earn points from collecting 2 or 4 of the same number as well as consecutive cards in a suit. There are also points to be gained for winning no tricks.

The player with the most points after a series of rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: Solys Expansion
boardgame.description: A red dragon miniature, that replaces a cardboard component from the core box.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: The Fog of Revolt
boardgame.description: The Fog of Revolt expansion (set in the Kingdom of Stone-Hills region), which again offers you a FULL environment, with all the figures and tiles related to this adventure that the Companions of the Spear will live. Note that if you take this expansion, the 5 scenarios (3 scenarios + 1 Mini-Boss scenario + 1 Boss scenario) included will be part of the full campaign. But this remains optional and you can still play the campaign without this expansion. In other words, the campaign will adapt to the expansions you have: it will offer ellipses and an experience system adapted to the expansions you own besides the Core Box. Also note that the Core Box will contain 4 regions: Jade Sea, Forge and Anastyr’s Fortress (already in the Core Box) + 1 region (Bone Swamp) that will be unlocked as stretch goals (it will by the end of the campaign!). That’s a total for this Core Box campaign of 18 scenarios.

boardgame.name: Trick and Trade
boardgame.description:
Trick and Trade is a "may-follow" trick-taking game themed around cryptocurrency speculation.

There are four suits for the 4 competing currencies, and a separate deck of cards which will represent the players' holdings in those currencies.

At the end of a trick, the highest ranked card of the lead suit goes to a market area, with the market value of cards being inversely related to their rank. Also at the end of a trick, the players draft, in card strength order, one of the holdings cards from a face up display.

At the end of a hand, the players will rank the currency's values based upon the cards from each suit which won tricks, with the most valued being worth 3 points per holding, then 2, then 1, then -1. The players value their holdings, record their scores, and the player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

boardgame.name: Anastyr: The All-Mother's Secret
boardgame.description: The Primordial Jungles are home to the densest forests of Alboraan. Legend has it that this mysterious, impenetrable land was seeded from the tears of the All-Mother weeping over her people, slaughtered by dragons in ancient times. The forests are so dense that light rarely reaches the ground. An inextricable network of lianas and branches makes any progression hostile and laborious. In the shadows lurk the terrible saber-toothed tigers and immense carnivorous plants.Few are those who dare to penetrate this compact green danger zone and make contact with the fierce tribes living near the ancient temples of their ancestors. But they are also the guardians of the black lotus, a flower with extraordinary properties... The Companions of the Spear know that this flower would be an unparalleled asset in the fight against the forces of Anastyr, but this quest comes at a cost. The powerful Tanit, known as the goddess of the jungle, reigns supreme over this trade and convincing her will not be easy. In addition, the goddess who claims to be the reincarnation of the All-Mother herself is waging her own war against the tribes who refuse to join her cult, and in particular against Karanja, her main rival.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: The Necromancer's Plague
boardgame.description:
The Bone Swamp lies between the Jade Sea and the Dark Swamp. This territory is named after the megadons who have lived in this area for centuries. The skeletons of their ancestors can be seen above the stagnant waters and in some places they look like open graveyards. The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs.

The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs. Each tribe was born in the wake of one of these ancestral creatures, whose name it has taken. Over the centuries, the tribe watches over the offspring of "their" megadon and ensures that it matures safe from predators. The primitive tribes live in lakeside villages. The matriarch's home is always found at the center of these villages, where wood is mixed with the remains of the ancestral megadon's egg. The Firstborn communication uses very specific tongue clicks, which allows them to hunt over large areas and to implement their battle plans against their enemies.

When moving through the swamps, the Primitives use stilts, the length of which determines their social position within the tribe. To travel longer distances, they ride Kurdai, mounts imported from the High Plains centuries ago. Today, kurdai are found in most village enclosures but also in the wild, as they have become an endemic animal of the swamps.

Unfortunately, an unprecedented threat has been looming over the Bone Swamp for nearly twenty years: the Plague. This disease corrupts living creatures, both animals and humans. In its final stage, the infected become rabid and kill each other. The Firstborn fear that the megadon eggs will also fall victim to this terrifying disease, especially since some of them are regularly traded during the passage of the Great Caravan, in exchange for iron and precious stones... These extremely precious eggs are indeed sought after by all the caravan masters, to enlarge their convoy and ensure their prosperity.

boardgame.name: Rex
boardgame.description:
This is a track game, copyright 1888, with "safety tracks" (turnouts) on each side. In fact, it almost exactly resembles the board layout of Parker Brothers' later games Pollyanna and The Popular Game of Broadway. The only real difference is that there are no "home" paths branching off of the main track.

It is first seen in the Parker Games catalog for 1889, on page 5. The ads do not indicate how the game is played, only that it includes "turned maple pieces" and a spinner. Identical listings are found in the 1890 and 1891 catalogs.

By 1892, Rex is being packaged with The Amusing Game of Kilkenny Cats as two sides of a "combination" board game. It is available in this form until 1895.

boardgame.name: Krig
boardgame.description: Krig is a varient of Game of the Generals. The game simulates armies at war trying to overpower, misinform, outflank, outmaneuver, and destroy each other. It optimizes the use of logic, memory, and spatial skills. It simulates the "fog of war" because the identities of the opposing pieces are hidden from each player and can only be guessed at by their location, movements, or from the results of challenges. The game allows only one side's plan to succeed, although a player may change plans during the course of the game. In addition, there are two different ways of winning the game. Certain strategies and tactics, however, allow both sides the chance of securing a better idea of the other's plan as the game progresses.

boardgame.name: State of Decay 2: Daybreak
boardgame.description:
Defend yourself against a time-critical zombie siege in pulse-pounding Daybreak! Play as a Red Talon soldier fighting off seven waves of zombies. Earn prestige to redeem rare items for your main campaign. Best experienced with friends!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Chilli or Chunder: Chilli Eating Contest Game
boardgame.description:
As chilli eating contestants there are two things you focus on: Eating more chillies than the other contestants. The other... Not chundering!

Over five rounds of ever increasing hotness, you will eat your way through each chilli, bite by bite. You will need to keep down the bites and once the whole chilli is gone, you show your empty mouth before progressing to the next round. Or fall victim to the chilli, either by failing to take the next bite or chundering it back up.

Outlast your fellow contestants to take the crowning glory and become the Chilli or Chunder Champion!

Included is the 5th and 6th contestant expansion "Chilli or Chunder: Hot Stuff", with two new ways to play:

- First Timer (more challenging)
Having never eaten hot stuff chillies before but decided to give the contest a go none the less, this contestant shows determination of steel, but without the matching stomach.

- Professional (less challenging)
A hot stuff chilli eating machine, this contestant should eat up this contest.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ESHIP: Navigating Uncertainty
boardgame.description:
The Game
Players test their team-based decision-making abilities within the safe environment of a game. They role-play, discuss, narrate, and make strategic decisions under uncertain conditions simulated by characters, traits, unforeseen events, team-communication, and time pressure.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Winning condition
In contrast to many other games, a lower score leads you to success. In a multi-team setting, the team with the lowest uncertainty score wins.

boardgame.name: Our Haunt
boardgame.description:
We are ghosts. We are in a house we don't recognize. We have a handful of memories, and these memories are brief moments and flashes of barely something. The Living are nearby, and the encroach on our space, making their demands. Worse, there is a Thing in the Walls. It is ancient, inhuman. Hungry, yearning. Angry.

But this is Our Haunt now. This is our home, and we only have each other as family. If we take care of each other, good things we'll happen. We just know it.

Our Haunt is a tabletop RPG about a family of ghosts built on the Belonging Outside Belonging system, inspired by games like Dream Askew/Dream Apart, Wanderhome, and Balikbayan: Returning Home. It's a rules-light engine with no dice and no masters, focused around tokens and community play.

(from the Kickstarter page)

boardgame.name: Bardsung: Fables
boardgame.description: Kickstarter Exclusive expansion to Bardsung that includes several new heroes, enemies and scenarios to use with the core game

boardgame.name: Lofoten
boardgame.description:
Now considered to be one the most beautiful archipelagos in the world, Lofoten was an important Viking territory. Knowing how to adapt to various situations, Vikings were not only peaceful settlers and builders, but invaders and skilled merchants, as well. With your fleet of longships, you are determined to make the most of the 4 essential goods.
Also try to become the most powerful Jarl of the archipelago!

Goal of the Game
In Lofoten, you must load merchandise from the market into your longships, and bring them back to your clan. For each type of merchandise, a particular scoring will grant you an advantage over the opposing Jarl. No matter what the situation is, your goal is to earn more PP (Power Points) than the opposing Jarl in the final scoring, to become the most powerful Jarl in the archipelago!

Lofoten, is a game for two players with innovative card hand management and a rotating board.

boardgame.name: Where the wheat grows tall
boardgame.description: Where the Wheat Grows Tall is an old-school fantasy adventure for low level characters inspired by Slavic myth. Deeper than a dungeon crawl, this adventure is filled with personalities and relationships boiling beneath the surface. Cross the old stone wall and discover a different world that follows different rules in twenty keyed locations.

boardgame.name: Sunset
boardgame.description: In Sunset, players take turns to shape the sunset. Each turn, a player may choose to expand the sky by placing a colored card in a grid. Or, they can place a cloud on a sky card. They may also move the sun token (sideways or down). When the top row is completed, each player chooses a scoring card from their hand. On these cards are descriptions such as “grey clouds in the top row”, “pink cards in the sky” or “clouds on the top row”. The player with the highest scoring card places it in front of them. The top row is removed and the game continues until one player has collected three scoring cards.

boardgame.name: Strike HQ
boardgame.description:
Strike HQ is a two-player, head-to-head, expandable battle card game that brings the classic thrill of real-time strategy (RTS) video games to the tabletop.


Starting with only a Headquarters and a handful of units, you play commanders of opposing factions and will use an innovative blend of simultaneous action programming and hidden information mechanics to construct your bases, deploy more units, and launch a strike against the enemy HQ.

The game takes 2 minutes to set up, plays in around one hour, and you win by either destroying your opponent’s HQ through an overwhelming offensive or by sitting back and storing up enough resources to launch a game-ending Atomic Strike!

Gameplay is inspired by classic PC RTS video games of the 1990s like Command & Conquer: Red Alert, and more recently Company of Heroes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fabelland
Fableland
boardgame.description:
Fableland is THE magical amusement park!

Countless guests tumble around the park. They ride fantastic carousels and then run straight to the next attraction! Who will manage to lure them into their own rides and thus collect the most balloons?

It's also worth investing the balloons in better attractions and influencers to get even more balloons! Whoever manages to anticipate the actions of the opponents will be swimming in balloons and will be the winner!

A family game by Moritz Schuster for 2 to 5 people, full of positive interaction, as you always let a few guests run into the attractions of the other players.

Will your attractions ultimately attract the most guests?

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Battleforce Counters Pack
boardgame.description:
Five punchboards representing two armies of nearly eighty Unit and Command counters each.

Two maps that form a large Strategic BattleForce map; laminated, the back side can be used to create your own worlds.

The first ever published, super-sized Inner Sphere at War map (2786 & 3025)

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Dark Age
boardgame.description: Technical Readout: Dark Age expands on Technical Readout: Succession Wars, Technical Readout: Clan Invasion, and Technical Readout: Jihad by combining the ’Mechs previously found in Technical Readout: 3075, Technical Readout: 3085 (and its Supplemental), Technical Readout: 3145, Technical Readout: Irregulars, Technical Readout: Prototypes, and more. This volume features some of the most common ’Mechs from the Dark Age. Each machine is accompanied by an illustration, a description of its history, capabilities, and game stats.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume VI - Adventure on the High Seas)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume VI contains the following:

MAGIC ITEMS - Any sailor worth their salt knows there’s treasure on the seas more precious than gold and jewels. These eleven magic items are waiting to be found.

SHIP AUGMENTS - Make your ship the terror of the high seas with these four easy-to-install additions.
