ARCHETYPES - Four new subclasses that are ready to plunder untold riches.

BLESSINGS AND BANES: THE BOONS AND CURSES OF THE SEA - The seas are alive with all manner of blessings and banes. Fifteen new afflictions await those whotravel these waters.

GM VARIANT RULE: GLORY AND INFAMY - Loathed or trusted, feared or famed, a captain’s name is worth more than his weight in gold. These variant rules allow GMs to assign their players a reputation on the high seas.

GM VARIANT RULE: FEATS OF FAME AND FORTUNE - Not all skills learned on the high seas can be taught. These eight feats are earned by only the most infamous.

SAILING THE SEAS: BATTLEMAPS - Three additional battlemaps (with grid and no-grid versions) are available so your players can loot and plunder to their heart'scontent.

boardgame.name: Tavern Sign Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Tavern Sign Generator contains 8 tables to help you describe an original sign for every tavern your characters may visit. These tables will tell you about the shape, the material, the position, the mounting, the content of your sign, and more!

This product also contains 3 black and white vector illustrations. It is in A5 format, has a black and white cover page, and can easily be printed as a booklet.

Come in, we're open!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental
boardgame.description: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental provides details and gameplay statistics for additional infantry, battle armor, vehicles, 'Mechs, and aerospace units that debuted during the Jihad and its immediate aftermath.

boardgame.name: Storms of Kiselia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A routine resupply mission to one of Kiselia 7’s moons leads to conflict with the ruthless Orion Syndicate

On the moon Hydralon, a research team surveys ancient ruins and studies local flora and fauna. The team is low on supplies, but no problems have been reported, so this should be a simple mission, and it doesn’t hurt that Hydralon is said to be an idyllic locale. The crew could use some shore leave, and exploring the hot springs and lush forests of Hydralon sounds like the perfect respite from long months in space.

Unfortunately, shore leave will have to wait. Upon arrival, it’s clear that the Orion Syndicate has its sights set on profit. The situation develops as the Syndicate, local fauna, and stellar phenomena align to make the crew’s job even more dangerous. Can you ensure the safety of Hydralon’s science team under increasingly difficult circumstances?

This 23-page PDF adventure for the Star Trek Adventures Roleplaying Game is written by Jared Twing, and is set during The Next Generation era with the player characters being the crew of a Federation ship. This adventure also contains advice on adaptation for use in campaigns based in other Star Trek eras and contains a one-page mission brief to continue the story after the events of the main mission.

boardgame.name: The Emperor's Wrath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Steam Tanks are mechanical wonders created by the genius Leonardo di Miragliano in 2025 IC and mostly kept in working order by the Imperial College of Engineers in Altdorf. They are enormous war machines, capable of propelling themselves over rough terrain and mounting large pieces of artillery.

Whilst the Engineers are able to keep eight of the contraptions in working order, the secrets of their construction died with Leonardo. The remaining tanks are therefore highly prized, so when one of them goes missing on the road to Carroburg competent and discrete investigators are sought to track it down.

The Emperor's Wrath is a complete adventure for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, but also includes a comprehensive guide to the history of the Empire's Steam Tanks, the weapons and equipment they carry, and how to pilot one of these steel behemoth in games.

This scenario features:
● A gripping mystery to discover what became of the Steam Tank Emperor’s Wrath.
● A history of Steam Tanks, twelve wonders of engineering built centuries ago and maintained by engineers of Altdorf.
● Rules for operating a Steam tank in Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay.
● Rules and background for the Bog Mummies, ancient Wights who haunt the fens and mires of the Old World.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Boxed Set
boardgame.description:
In Battletech: Alpha Strike, you take command of large-scale engagements, fueled by tabletop miniatures gameplay designed for the modern wargamer. Inside is everything you need to start tossing dice and moving miniatures on your game table.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Ad Hoc Unit Cards
Battletech: Alpha Strike – Alpine/Lunar Hexless Battlemap
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Assault Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Battle Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Clan Invasion Cards
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Command Lance Pack
Battletech: Alpha Strike – Dropships and Small Craft Cards
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Fire Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Pursuit Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Recon Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Striker Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Succession Wars Cards
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Support Lance Pack
BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Warships and Jumpships Cards
BattleTech: Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance
BattleTech: Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance
BattleTech: Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance

boardgame.name: Boxcar Battle
boardgame.description: Build the highest scoring trains while preventing your opponents from doing the same. Players are dealt cards with train cars depicted on them including engines, boxcars, tankers, flat cars, and cabooses. Different cars have various abilities that raise or lower the point total of the train onto which it is played. On their turn the player plays one card on any of their trains or an opponents train them chooses another card from the deck. Play continues until all three track cards are discovered from the deck at which time points are totaled.

boardgame.name: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game: LITKO Game Upgrade Set
boardgame.description:
(77) LITKO Upgrade Set Compatible with Dresden Files Card Game, Multi-Color

Compatible with The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game.

Players take the role of literary hero Harry Dresden and his allies to play as a team against the game itself. Each game plays through one of the Dresden Files stories; players solve cases and defeat their foes. All players win if they have solved more cases than rivals remaining at the end of the game.

This set provides the players with upgraded acrylic tokens to replace and expand the game’s cardboard tokens. Each is designed to complement the game and the original designs with unique shapes, colors, and etching. This Upgrade Set will replace all cardboard tokens provided with the game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game

boardgame.name: AIRFLIP
boardgame.description:
AIRFLIP is a flip/roll&write game set in an airport.
Players are in charge of boarding their planes the best possible way while facing picky passengers.

Shuffle the passenger cards and make three piles, flip the first card on their call number side of each pile below them.
Each passenger has a passport value (victory points) and will be able to board your plane if you meet their requirements (some want to seat in the front of the plane, some want to be near an exit, etc...).
Roll your dice and use them to board the passengers you want depending on their call number value (your dice must match or exceed this value).
Plan carefully the boarding of your plan, win bonuses and be the first to board your plane entirely with the most valuable passengers to win the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Quick Guide to Random Cities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A quick guide to help you to create and add cities to your rpg game. This supplement is friendly to any kind of setting, filled with concepts and generators to provide quick and simple steps to facilitate adjustments and improvisation.

boardgame.name: Curse of the Dark
boardgame.description:
In the remote mountain village of Mordengraf, people are disappearing. Investigating reports of a 'creature' stalking the area, you venture into Castle Mordengraf, the Gothic castle overshadowing the village.

Captured by an unseen force, you must escape the castle's dungeon or become the creature's latest victim. But you only have three hours before the creature resumes its hunt ...

Curse of the Dark is a co-operative escape room game, where players must build out the floorplan of Castle Mordengraf, uncovering and exploring new rooms of the castle to advance the story. The game features puzzle books, map tiles and other interactive components and features. A smartphone or Internet-connected device is required for some of the puzzles.

Curse of the Dark features a tiered hint system, to enable teams of all abilities to progress through the game and story. The game can optionally be completed solo.

Curse of the Dark is designed as a one-time experience, as some of the puzzles require players to cut, fold and write on the components. However, Professor Puzzle do provide a printable pdf of the destructible components, in the Files section on BGG and on their website, to enable the game to be replayed.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Artifacts of the Old World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of artifacts inspired by European folklore.

boardgame.name: Acererak's Guide to Lichdom
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Discover secrets, powers and allies of the lich.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Troll Ref - Races of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From arguing cave trolls to troll kings to under-the-bridge trolls, these hideous and disgusting cause havoc into fantasy, mythology, horror, and even a few romance fiction games and other media.

boardgame.name: Kick Off: Coach
boardgame.description:
Become the coach and manager of your club. Line up the right players in the right positions, build the right tactic deck, manage your team's environment and much more to lead your club to the championship!

Kick Off - Coach can be played over several seasons or for one championship. Each season is divided into match days, during which you can allocate your resources to your various staff and action options: from training, stadium and club infrastructure development to the transfer market and much more. You compete against each other on match days. Kick Off - Coach uses a unique momentum mechanic in combination with a tactical card deck, which challenges you to perfectly coordinate your line-up, tactics, playing style and the stamina of your players.

The game can be played with 1 to 8 players, with easy-to-use bots taking over clubs. Due to the parallel processing of the game days, there is little downtime and the game time is not extended. If you play over several seasons, an additional legacy effect comes into play through the development of the players and the club.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Attack on the Death Moon Hex Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The idea is that you are in a ship trying to attack a Death Moon. You use the Hex Flower (HF) to procedurally map your progress toward the Death Moon’s Exhaust Port, so that you can attack it and destroy the Death Moon. On the journey to the Exhaust Port, you will encounter events/outcomes represented by the various icons.

There is also a Hex Flower for tracking an opponent in 3D space relative to your ship each turn (relative direction and height from your ship).

boardgame.name: 20 Unexpected Rooms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

System-Neutral, Fantasy, Non-Balanced, Dungeon, Room Encounters

The idea here is that if you want to throw a room at some PCs, perhaps this is an unexpected room/encounter, then here is a list of rooms for inspiration, or useful for a solo gamer.

boardgame.name: Carapace | Supplement - Queen Encounter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a one page supplement for Carapace.

I thought my Carapace adventure would be more interesting if the 'boss' encounter was made less generic, and had some links back to the NPC goals.

Basically, the Queen tries to communicate with the PCs using pheromones. Each PC only gets part of the message (a single word). This should provide the players with some quandaries ...

boardgame.name: Class Ideas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This document offers 8 new classes.

User summary:

Augur, Catabolyist, Gambler, Infiltrator, Shire Runner, Shaman, Urchin, and Wereman.

boardgame.name: Combat Morale Tracker
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This Hex Flower is intended to track the morale of the PC's henchman/hirelings, and of the monsters in combat. It is intended to be reasonably light-weight so an not to bog combat down. A check is made at the end of each round.

boardgame.name: Veins of the Earth Compatible Excel Random Cave Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Click a button and the worksheet tells you:


size of the cave
location of cave entrance
number of exits
where the exits are
size of each exit
how far to the next cave


User summary:

Intended for use with Veins of the Earth

boardgame.name: Flooding Temple Complex
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A puzzle - escape the complex before the place floods...

User summary:

An interesting and dynamic one-page adventure.

boardgame.name: Grimbo Grotto
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It twas the night before a crisp mass snowfall and nothing was stirring,
Except a drunken ‘potty-mouthed’ were-reindeer high on psychedelic mushrooms

boardgame.name: Pit of Unquiet Souls (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saare’s Pit has another, more lurid, name—and for good reason. The Pit of Unquiet Souls squats at the centre of a nest of macabre tales of madness, horror and death. It is said, those who spend too much time in the abandoned mine often go mad or disappear entirely, and old miners’ tales tell of the pit’s very rocks whispering horrible secrets to those toiling in its bowels. Still, there are those who think treasure yet lurks in the mine and will brave its terrors to retrieve them.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Ashlar campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Oranienburger Kanal: Erweiterung/Expansion I
boardgame.description:
In the tradition of Uwe's masterpiece Agricola, this game will include a number of expandable card sets which will change and add to your gaming experience.
The base game will come with two card sets (A & B) but four more sets will become available, adding endless replayability and variety to your games.
Each Expansion Set is boxed and contains 120 cards (2 sets) plus Glossaries in English and German!

-description from the Gamefound campaign page

boardgame.name: Oranienburger Kanal: Erweiterung/Expansion II
boardgame.description:
In the tradition of Uwe's masterpiece Agricola, this game will include a number of expandable card sets which will change and add to your gaming experience.
The base game will come with two card sets (A & B) but four more sets will become available, adding endless replayability and variety to your games.
Each Expansion Set is boxed and contains 120 cards (2 sets) plus Glossaries in English and German!

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hit Points Replaced with 'Usage Dice'
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Why? Who wants to track pesky Hit Points (HPs) anyway...?

boardgame.name: Horror is the Hill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Horror is the Hill is a one page system neutral point crawl set in a giant jack o'lantern. Perhaps perfect for a Halloween?

boardgame.name: In the Heart of the Eternal Forest
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Procedural point crawl engine for exploring a network of clearing in an Eternal Forest.

User summary:

The Blank Encounter version requires the user to fill in the encounter list with custom entries, prior to use.

boardgame.name: IsoExcel | Pseudo-Isometric mapping in Excel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Excel widget to help generate random a 3D-looking dungeon with the aid of a macro-button.

boardgame.name: IT Came from Below (or Above)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There must be the odd occasion you want to track ‘something’ e.g. a monster, relative to the PC’s location in three dimensions. The PCs might be in an airship or underwater. This Hex Flower is designed to do just that

boardgame.name: Law & (In)Justice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A series of events occurs during the trial, ultimately resulting in the PC(s) being acquitted or found guilty.

The trial is influenced by several factors:


If the PCs are actually innocent or guilty
If the Judge is corrupt


The PCs get points to spend during the 'trial' depending on factors like their repute, quality of lawyer (if any) and their charm.

boardgame.name: Mythic-Style Hex Flower Chaos Emulator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This engine is intended for use with Mythic Game Master Emulator.

It introduces a new way to track the Chaos Factor (CF) using a Hex Flower; and a different option for the YES / NO engine.

boardgame.name: Point Crawl Templates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a simple Point Crawl Template.

Use the grid and optional rules to make a simple and quick point crawl.

boardgame.name: Race & Class Hex Flower Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is just a fun way to generate random Race and Class combinations for PCs (or even NPCs) using a Hex Flower.

Maybe this is a good excuse to play a class-race combination that you would not normally try.

boardgame.name: Random Social Interaction Hex Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Random Social Interaction Hex Flower Generator provides a procedural way to generate NPC-NPC social interactions/entanglements.

Basically, add a number of NPCs to a Hex Flower structure, roll 3D6 for each and link them up in a web of intrigue using the suggested rules.

There are sample social interactions, but of course you can customise these to make your own.

boardgame.name: Session Zero - 'Consequences-Style' Background Builder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You must have played the “Consequences” game at some point. A group of people take turns to answer a series of questions on a sheet of paper, without seeing the previous answers, and so a random narrative is generated as a result.

I’ve come up with my version of this for RPGs. This is it. The idea is that each PC gets a randomly generated background by using the ‘Consequences’ type mechanic at the table. I suppose it’s not necessary for everyone to have their PC’s background generated this way (but that would be more fun), as long as everyone doesn’t mind chipping in to help fill out the questions.

In my version, people get to read the answer directly above the box they are filling in, just to aid with the consistency of the narrative.

The idea is that the answers to the questions can be used to ‘seed’ a background, or used as is (maybe needing a bit of a narrative/tweak to weave things together i.e. to join up the dots).

boardgame.name: They Came from Karnstein's Cabinet of Curiosities!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For every artifact there's a tale. For every relic a warning. Yet still you feel the lure to rifle through Karnstein's wares. You want to see the mystical, experience the forbidden, and taste the obscene.

Dare you enter Karnstein's Cabinet of Curiosities?

This Tasty Bit for They Came from Beyond the Grave! contains a plethora of story hooks for your Beyond the Grave! games, a new setting to use for your adventures, and new Conditions to inflict on your protagonists, among many more fun and mysterious features.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Simple Excel Mapper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A simple tool for making D&D / RPG maps.

The Excel Mapper is a workbook for use in Microsoft Excel.

The cells have been formatted into squares. Individual keystrokes entered into individual cells will generate simple graphic results, generating walls, shaded walls, water etc., and so allowing for simple but rapid generation of maps.

You can also create your own conditional formatting for more/different results.

I've also included some icons that might be useful.

User summary:

Distributed as an XLSX sheet and a 1-page PDF "commands" print-and-play reference sheet.

boardgame.name: The Gambler
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Gambler is a person ruled by fates, omens and fortunes. They perceive everything through the lens of luck and chance. For a Gambler, everything happens for a reason. For a Gambler Luck: is as real as a baked potato; is cat-fickle and has a mood; is flattered by rituals and appeased by signs; is consistently unpredictable; is offended and implacable; is passionately for or against you; is never fair; is dangerous to define; is like your best friend’s lover.

boardgame.name: Weather Hex Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Hex Flower enables you to generate weather in a random yet reasonably consistent way.

Hex Flowers are a bit like a random table, but with a 'memory'.

boardgame.name: S.M.A.R.T. RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

S.M.A.R.T. RPG is a one page rules light RPG system that uses a simple 1d6 resolution mechanic.

This single 1d6 roll mechanic resolves both the success and the magnitude of that success.

boardgame.name: S.M.A.R.T. Cyber RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adaptation of S.M.A.R.T. RPG to support a "cyber" genre.

boardgame.name: The Weird
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In 1947, nine crescent moon-shaped objects were spotted flying thousands of miles per hour over Mount Rainier. In 1811, explorers discovered the first evidence of Sasquatch. Just last week, reports of multiple ghost sightings popped up in New York City. What do all of these have in common?

The Weird.

We first found the connection between these seemingly unrelated events just a few years back. Dates seem to line up. Locations seem to be specific. Something is connecting all of these events.

That's where you come in.

You, alongside a select group of experts, are now tasked with exploring and understanding these phenomena… And stop them if necessary.

boardgame.name: Maple Valley
boardgame.description:
On the day when the last snowflake of winter has melted away, all of the critters emerge from their cozy homes to celebrate...and that day is today! Maple Valley's annual Spring Jamboree is a gathering of friends welcoming the warm months ahead, and you don't have a lot of time to prepare!

While the adults get the village into shape, the youngest (and swiftest) forest animals from each den are sent scrambling through the blossoming woods, completing the last-second tasks that will make the Jamboree a success. The trails aren't always clear; you'll need to climb, swim, and dig your way to the most bountiful groves, forage for fresh spring ingredients to help villagers complete their errands, and unearth curiosities that will attract skillful scouts to your growing team. The sun will set before you know it; will it be your hard work that makes this year's feast the best one ever?

Set in the delightful world of Creature Comforts, Maple Valley is a game of traveling trails, finding friends, and celebrating new beginnings for 1-5 critters.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Game Master's Assistant
The Game Master's Book of Random Tables
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to The Game Master’s Book of Random Tables (AKA The Game Master's Assistant): A Collection of Quick Roll Tables for the Busy Game Master – your one-stop resource offering more than 80 quick roll idea inspiring tables to help you quickly create encounters, describe objects, build NPCs, add depth to your descriptions and much more for your favorite fantasy role playing games.

boardgame.name: The Game Master's Assistant II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to The Game Master’s Assistant Volume II – your one-stop resource for more than 80 quick roll idea inspiring tables to help you quickly create encounters, describe objects, build NPCs, add depth to your descriptions, and much more.

boardgame.name: Town Tables: The Game Master's Town Builder Handbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One of the greatest memes in tabletop fantasy role playing games like Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder and many, many others that are played by millions every year is the town experience. No matter the game or group of players, the Game Master will soon be faced with bringing the adventurers to a town for some rest and relaxation. And while there, why not get them involved in the town by letting them interact with a variety of NPCs, explore businesses, interact with the town guard, get involved in a town secret and so much more to pique your player's curiosity.

Town Tables: The Game Master’s Town Builder Handbook is the definitive guide to creating and running towns in your role playing game. Combine bits and pieces from its 100+ tables and you will soon have a fully fleshed out immersive town setting for your players to explore. From tavern food and drink menus to NPCs to interesting shop items to atmosphere, this guide has everything you could ever look for.

Town Tables is your opportunity to rapidly turn a blah town setting into an exciting adventure for your players and a campaign that will be remembered long after the game has ended. Make your town encounter be all it was meant to be. Town Table offers all these tools to help you design your ultimate town encounters quickly and easily.

boardgame.name: 100 City Quests for a Curious Adventurer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to 100 City Quests for a Curious Adventurer – a fascinating list of exciting mini-adventures and activities a weary adventurer can enjoy when coming to a town and trying to build goodwill with the residents.

Many fantasy campaigns end up in a town or tavern between adventures. Rather than just have this portion of your campaign be nothing more than a checkmark, a pause if you will, between two quests, why not liven it up and make it memorable?

All it takes is a fun mini-quest helping townsfolk perform a particular task or solving an intriguing mystery to give them a welcome break from the grueling fighting and exploring of filth covered caves, slime-infested dungeons, and monsters lurking behind every corner.

This document details 100 quest seeds to get you started. It also includes some tips on fleshing out the details to make the stories you spin more engrossing and entertaining.

boardgame.name: More Spells for Fifth Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of new spells inspired from movies, anime, and imagination. In this PDF you will get over 20 new exciting combat and utility spells.

boardgame.name: A Pouch of Cantrips
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

15 New Cantrips

New cantrips for 5th Edition. These cantrips are just the thing to spice up your spell repertoire.

boardgame.name: Cheating FATE
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A cheat sheet for players and GMs of FATE core by Evil Hat Productions.

This is a ready to print handout for FATE core. At a glance you and your tablemates will see:


The Ladder
How to earn Fate Points
How to use Fate Points
The Four Actions
The Four Outcomes

boardgame.name: Form Fillable RPG Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A PDF of form-fillable cards for spellcards, NPC notes, abilities, and items. Just type what you want at your computer and print out you perfect cards ready for your next tabletop RPG session!

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Guide to Hair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bring the magic of hair into your games!

Hairy truths are universal, and they deserve a place at your table. This book provides you with ways to incorporate beards, wigs, braids, body hair, stylists, and more into the world's greatest roleplaying game.

With pages of spells, monsters, subclasses, backgrounds, and new deities, you are sure to find something to maximize your volume.

boardgame.name: Seven Days Battles 1862
boardgame.description:
Seven Days Battles 1862 is Volume III in the Civil War Brigade Battle Series. It is an old school style hex and counter wargame that allows gamers to refight battles from the 1862 Seven Days Battles that occurred outside of Richmond, VA. One player will play the Confederate side, and one player will play the Union side. The victory conditions are the destruction of the enemy army and capturing key terrain objectives. The game includes 8 scenarios over 4 separate battles. 2 of the scenarios allow the linking of 2 of the battles.

The battles included are Beaver Dam Creek, Gaine's Mill, Glendale, and Malvern Hill. Beaver Dam Creek and Gaine's Mill may be joined in one of the scenarios to cover two days of the batttles, while Glendale and Malvern Hill may be joined in another scenario to cover two other days of the battle.

The 6 single day scenarios can be played in 2 to 4 hours, while the 2 two day scenarios can be player in 6 - 8 hours.

The scenarios included are as follows:

Scenario 1: HISTORICAL BATTLE OF BEAVER DAM CREEK (one map)
Scenario 2: HERE COMES JACKSON (This scenario assumes Jackson is behind schedule but rouses himself to attack). (one map)
Scenario 3: JACKSON ARRIVES ON TIME (This scenario assumes Jackson arrives on time and is ready to fight). (one map)
Scenario 4: HISTORICAL BATTLE OF GAINES MILL (one map)
Scenario 5: BEAVER DAM CREEK TO GAINES MILL (two map)
Scenario 6: HISTORICAL BATTLE OF GLENDALE. (two map)
Scenario 7: HISTORICAL BATTLE OF MALVERN HILL. (one map)
Scenario 8: GLENDALE TO MALVERN HILL (two map)

There are special rules to portray Stonewall Jackson's lethargy during this campaign.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Snitches Get Stitches: the card game
boardgame.description:
Snitches Get Stitches: the card game, is a game of "Riotous Prison Fun" for 3-6 players ages 13 and up. Players will recruit "gang members" and collect "contraband" in order to reduce their prison sentence and get out of prison first. Shanking other players, stealing their contraband, or encouraging their gang members to defect are all useful strategies to win. This turn-based card game gives players the opportunity to collect sets of contraband, trade with other players, and cheat, steal or lie their way to the finish.

Just remember, "he who shanks last, shanks best!"

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kuddly Kymera
boardgame.description:
Play cards from your hand to create the cutest animal for yourself and leave your opponents with a hideous monster! Modifier cards rule, like a rainbow tail for bonus points to you or scaly skin to an opponent for negative points. Appropriate for all ages.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dualing Dice
boardgame.description:
Dualing Dice is a new strategy dice board game from Mythica Gaming in which 2 to 4 players face off by rolling two dice at a time in a duel to be the first to complete their goals.

You can choose your pair of dice to maximize the odds, or you can pick your favorites and take your chances with Lady Luck. Select your own roll, or steal an opponent's to interrupt their strategy. Play a light, friendly game or a cut-throat battle... it all depends on the players at the table.

The first player to earn 15 points by completing their goal card conditions wins the game—but everyone’s a winner when they get to roll dice!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#10 - Flame to the Rescue - Void Warriors)
boardgame.description:
This issue of Blaster Bolts features


Flame to the Rescue- a determined heroine is on a rescue mission in this space western by writer Mel Todd.
Void Warriors- a new retro adventure set in the Synborg Apocalyse setting from RPG luminary Darrin Drader for the White Star RPG

boardgame.name: Simulacrum Umbra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Simulacrum Umbra is a dark fantasy RPG that aims to challenge the players in hideous and unfortunate adventures through the lands of the collective imagination of those involved in this amorphous mass of blood, shit and viscera.

Here you will find a cool freeform magic system, a fast paced and deadly combat, old school inventory management and some simple tables that create an environment for open world exploration.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Alternate Art Crew Cards
boardgame.description:
Alternate art crew cards available from the indiegogo campaign or as swag for attending FnordCon 2022.

Includes alternate art for:
- Rookie, Amateur, Veteran, and Legend Gunners
- Rookie, Amateur, Veteran, and Legend Drivers

boardgame.name: Savage Company Infantryman's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Attention!

Fall in and toe the line, to get issued your copy of the Savage Company Infantryman’s Handbook. This invaluable resource for Pathfinder 1e comes equipped with new archetypes, full build guides, powerful weapon modifications, and more. If you loved the infantryman class from the Savage Company Campaign Setting, this handbook will become standard issue for every game you play. The book also contains alternate rules for cover and combat, new equipment and weapons, and new short stories. Get yours today, no hand receipt required.

The Savage Company Infantryman’s Handbook includes:


1 class and 11 archetypes with full build guides
New fast paced alternate combat rules
15 all-new weapons
14 new ammunition types
4 new low-cost utility constructs to help you in the field
2 new short stories
Modular weapons and accessories with 22 options for crafting new and unique customized firearms
50 new artworks
OVER 100 PAGES


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Memories of the Sea
boardgame.description:
Memories of the Sea expands on the fringes of Albion established in Fallen Camelot (ruled by Queen Morgana, surrounded by aberrant magic and dangerous fae) by exploring the settlements of the Saxons. Once conquerers, they were defeated first by Arthur and further routed by the curse. Now they live on the fringes of Albion, surviving between haunted fens, dangerous woods, and treacherous seas.

This product includes the following:
- Expanded story options and adventure hooks,
- 12 new subclasses (one for each fore class),
- 8 new backgrounds options, using our modular background mechanic
- 3 new factions
- 20+ new creatures
- New items both magic and mundane, including 4 new ships.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Book of Exalted Darkness: Reduci Castle
boardgame.description:
Carstigle Wormhand is dead.
The powerful mage was said to have kept an apprentice and yet his lair remains abandoned, the many treasures and wonders within left for the taking.

There are defenders of course—creatures left to protect his legacy—but they are unique, laying in a cunning and clever trap that has claimed every intruder so far.

What makes you think you'll fare any better?

Book of Exalted Darkness: Reduci Castle is a locale and coterie of NPCs best suited for adventurers between 8th–10th level. Within you'll find statistics for 10 monsters and castle denizens, the Vile school of magic (over two dozen new and truly evil spells), as well as rules on expanded madness (more options for the short-term, long-term, and indefinite varieties).

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Escape Box: Pirates
boardgame.description:
Embark on a fabulous adventure aboard a pirate ship! The Pirate Captain lands on an abandoned island and leaves you 45 minutes to find the lost treasure of Pirate Buzzard.

It will be necessary to do quickly, because the Captain will not leave you a minute more! Time is running out, will you solve the riddles and bring back the loot to save you from the clutches of these dangerous pirates?

Recreate the atmosphere of an escape room at home! You have 45 minutes to find clues concealed by the Master of the Game that will allow you to solve all the puzzles.

boardgame.name: Agents of Dune Box Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

ARRAKIS IS YOURS

Your House is to become the new governor of Arrakis in an alternate “What if?” scenario, where you must ensure the supply of the vital spice melange to the Known Universe. With the eyes of the entire Imperium watching your every move, can you retain control of Arrakis? Or will this appointment spell the destruction of your House?

The Agents of Dune Campaign Experience Box Set offers a complete introduction to the world of Dune and the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium roleplaying game. The box contains everything you need to start playing, with no preparation required. Even if you are new to Dune or roleplaying games, this set guides you through an epic story where your characters are the heroes.

The Agents of Dune box set contains:


A complete 116-page adventure with step by step guidance as you play!!
5 character folios for the members of House Nagara.
Two 50-card decks detailing NPCs, Assets, and Traits for use during play.
A complete spice harvesting system to keep track of your successes or failures in running Arrakis.
3 Handouts and 4 zone maps that bring the experience of Arrakis to your gaming table.
54 tokens and 2 Trackers for Momentum, Threat, Determination.
Five custom D20s featuring the symbol of the great sandworms of Arrakis.
Also included in the box is a code to receive a free digital copy of the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium Core Rulebook to expand your campaign even further after play.

boardgame.name: La course des Casse-Tout
The Wreck-it Race
boardgame.description:
Today, it’s a free-for-all!
Today, you’re going to race head-on into a crazy Grand Prix!

Who do you want to be in this race?

Ambrose aboard “Tanky”, her armored tank.
Bip-Bop, in his “Futuro-Mobile”, a technological masterpiece.
Haru commanding “Red Lightning”, his super race car!


Choose carefully, as in this rather unusual story, your choices make the difference between winning and losing.

The Wreck-it Race is the fifth book in the My First Adventure collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

boardgame.name: RisiKo!: Antartide
boardgame.description:
RisiKo! Antarctica is the first edition of RisiKo!, the best known strategy game in Italy, which includes two games in one! In this version the dashboard is printed on the front and back to offer two different gaming experiences. Two-player mode: on one side the dashboard depicts Antarctica divided into 42 territories. A real head to head for the conquest of Antarctica!

The battle scenario moves to the new continent with new territories and new objectives! All the adrenaline of the best known strategy game, in a single edition! On the other side of the bridge, the continent of Antarctica, divided into two territories, East Antarctica and West Antarctica, serves as an expansion of the original game. If added as the seventh continent to the southern part of the hemisphere depicted on the classic RisiKo! board, transforms the entire world conquest scenario, acting as a bridge between territories and continents so far light years away. Having to conquer 24 territories will no longer be an impossible goal.

—description from the publisher (translated)


RisiKo! Antartide è la prima edizione di RisiKo!, il gioco di strategia più conosciuto in Italia, che include due giochi in uno! In questa versione la plancia è stampata fronte e retro per offrire due esperienze di gioco diverse. Modalità a due giocatori: da un lato la plancia raffigura l’Antartide suddivisa in 42 territori. Un vero e proprio testa a testa per la conquista dell’Antartide!

Lo scenario di battaglia si sposta sul nuovo continente con nuovi territori e nuovi obiettivi! Tutta l’adrenalinia del gioco di strategia più conosciuto, in una edizione unica! Sull’altro lato della plancia il continente dell’Antartide, diviso in due territori, l’Antartide Orientale e l’Antartide Occidentale, funge da espansione del gioco originale. Se aggiunta come settimo continente alla parte sud dell’emisfero raffigurato sulla plancia di RisiKo! classico, trasforma l’intero scenario di conquista del mondo, fungendo da ponte tra territori e continenti fino ad ora lontani anni luce. Devi conquistare 24 territori non sarà più un’obiettivo impossbile.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pie Y'all
boardgame.description:
Try not to get pied in this game of Pie Y'all from Ridley's Games!

In this fun-filled, family-friendly twist on the classic game of Sh*thead, don't be the one left with pie on your face!

On your turn, try to play a card of equal or higher value if you can, and if not you need to pick up the entire discard pile.

The object of the game is to not be the last person to be rid of all your cards, so you'll want to try to give away as much pie as possible!

Be sure to keep a pie out for several upper crust cards like the Key Lime Pie-rate and the Lemon Buff Pastry!

Perfect for pie enthusiasts, families, and groups of friends, it comes in a sweet pie illustrated tin and is suitable for ages 8+, 2-5 players, and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Hospital: ER – Emergency Roll: VIPs Promo
boardgame.description:
VIPs: Very Important Patients is a mini-expansion for Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll. It gives every player a chance to score additional points by admitting an extra-special patient to their hospital and matching the VIP's specific preferences.

It is 6-card expansion included in the Dice Theme Park and Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll Promo Pack #2.

boardgame.name: Stomp The Monster
boardgame.description:
See who's the best at monster spotting in this snap card game Stomp the Monster from Ridley's Games!

You and your friends are out searching for the elusive Stomp, the Monster. But on your trek, you've lost your batteries and only have one working camera between you all!

The aim of the game is to be the first player to find two batteries and have the camera in front of you to snap a picture of Stomp to win!

As you play, you'll want to try to collect batteries by either getting a double battery card or winning a snap on a numbered card that features batteries on it, as when you do you get to keep that battery card. And each time there is a snap, the camera card moves to the next player. So you'll want to have collected two batteries and have the camera card in front of you when the Stomp card comes up, for if you do, you've won!

Packaged in a sasquatch style container, this game is perfect for families and groups of friends, for Halloween or year-round monster fun!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Theme Park: Medic Administrator Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Included in the Dice Theme Park and Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll Promo Pack.

The medic administrator for Dice Theme Park - which returns any colour dice that is leaving your park back to your entrance at a value of 4

boardgame.name: Adulting
boardgame.description:
Get ready for a hilarious night in for fully groan-up adults with Adulting from Ridley's Games!

Finally, a game where you're rewarded for when you do the dishes straight away and show up to work on time!

First, pick a badge randomly and read it to yourself without showing the other players. Then, it's time to put those hustling skills you earned working three jobs to cover off rent and your cat's deluxe silk bed and organic food subscription to use!

Do ANYTHING you can think of to EARN that badge while other players try to guess what achievement your badge is for. This isn't charades though -- you can speak, make noise and use nearby stuff like furniture, props, and even people!

The player who has earned the most badges and pins by the end of the game is the ultimate adult!

Perfect for millennials and any other adults who still don't know how to throw a proper dinner party, it's suitable for 3-5 players and has an average 20 minute gameplay. Can be played with roommates in your shared apartment, at the dinner table in your parent's house, or at your married friend's three-bedroom bungalow.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Komoro Toko's Menagerie
boardgame.description:
A Mists of Akuma adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 12th level

In fractured Rimono Prefecture there is one figure who stands above the destruction and mayhem, his presence holding back the tide of chaos that threatens to set the countryside and cities alight: Komoro Toko. Tragedy has struck however and the vigilante samurai is now wanted for murder! The PCs are hired by a Rimono bengoshi to track down Komoro Toko and discover his true identity, but the closer they get the more they learn that much of what they've been told is untrue. Can the adventurers unravel the mystery and reveal who is pulling their strings in time to save the capital city of Shori from destruction at the hands of Komoro Toko's greatest enemies!?

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Awk-Word
boardgame.description:
Act fast and shout out in the game of Awk-Word from Ridley's Games!

In this hella cool game, you'll want to collect the most chips by shouting words really fast.

So what's the 411? After the dice have been rolled, players take turns shouting words that fit a topic. For example, if the topic is PIZZA TOPPINGS, you might shout “Pepperoni" or "Olives" or “Anchovies” BUT you can’t shout a word that begins with any of the letters showing on the dice! When you shout a valid answer that the referee approves, you get to take a chip.

But be quick with your answers (like, two seconds max), because if the referee feels you're taking too long, they can ring the Awk-Word bell on you and you'll be out for that round! You'll be totally buggin, but don't worry, you'll be able to play again in the next round.

Play continues until each player has been the referee three times, and if you have the most chips, you win! Booyah!

Perfect for groups of friends, families and 90s lovers, it's suitable for ages 13+, 2-7 players and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Draw It, See It, Say It
boardgame.description:
Draw, memorize, or bluff your way to victory in Draw It, See It, Say It from Ridley's Games!

In this awesome party game trio that will have everyone guessing, there's three ways to play: drawing, seeing, or saying.

Roll the dice and take a category card that matches the color shown on the dice. Pink means it's time to test your artistic skills, and the player then needs to draw one of the two prompts (easy or hard) with all other players guessing what it is.

Yellow puts your memory to the test, with the player trying to memorize and then recall the color of one of the symbols on the card randomly selected by another player.

Green will test your bluffing skills, with the player trying to convince the other players whether or not they're being truthful about what's on the card.

The game ends when any player has won 3 cards of each color, and the player with the most points is the winner!

Perfect for families and groups of friends, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-8 players, and has an average of 30 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Grab A Slice
boardgame.description:
Get a pizza' the action with Grab A Slice from Ridley's Games!

In this supreme pizza game with all the tasty toppings, try to win points by rolling the dice to match the good type of toppings on a pizza card.

Start by grabbing a slice card that could come in handy later! Then, roll as many times as you like to try to win a pizza card, hopefully rolling enough of the good ingredients pictured in order to win it! But other players may challenge you for that pizza card! And if you roll too many of the bad ingredients listed, you'll go bust for that turn!

But beware, at the end of the game, the leading player rolls a die one final time to select a topping -- the player who grabbed the slice with that topping at the start of the game gets bonus points, and could potentially come out in the lead!

The player with the most points wins the game as the ultimate pizza aficiona-dough!

Freshly delivered in a pizza style box, it's perfect for pizza lovers or anyone who loves a cheesy party game. With gameplay for both small and large groups, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-6 players and has an average 30 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper using vegetable inks.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Paint the Roses: The Caterpillar Module
boardgame.description:
This module is best played with the Escape the Castle expansion rules and components.

In order to win, you need to achieve the module objective without being caught by the Queen.

Playing with the expansion?
Setup the game as per the Escape the Castle rules using the Caterpillar Helper cards.

Playing without the expansion?
Setup the game as per the Paint the Roses rules.
Place the 8 Caterpillar helper cards back in the box.

Your objective is to create high places for the Caterpillar to relax and view the garden.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Escape the Castle: A Paint the Roses Expansion

boardgame.name: Soburin Ancestries
boardgame.description:
This is a companion book for the Shadow of the Demon Lord version of Mists of Akuma, an eastern fantasy noir steampunk campaign setting. It is filled with tables for the many ancestries of Soburin along with new illustrations that make it a great addition for 5E folks looking for more flavor from this dark world of woe and despair.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Adventurer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Gear up for Adventure!

The Adventurer’s Handbook is a collection of new vehicles, weapons, armour and equipment for both players and Gamemasters to incorporate into games of Age of Steel. With new rules for adding modifications to vehicles and upgrades to weapons, armour and mechaugmetics, this book is everything an aspiring gadgeteer needs!

A copy of the Age of Steel rulebook is required to use this supplement.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Puppenspiel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Es könnte ein Routineauftrag sein: Die Helden müssen eine hölzerne Waldmenschen-Statuette zu einem verschrobenen Sammler in Mirham bringen. Dort soll sie in einem kleinen Kreis unter Gästen versteigert werden. Andererseits ist es eben Mirham, die südaventurische Stadt voller dekadenter Adliger, heimtückischer Verschwörer und schwarzkünstlerischer Verwandlungsmagier. So stellt sich spätestens vor Ort heraus: Es sind sehr viele Personen sehr interessiert an der geheimnisvollen Statuette. Darunter eine Alchimistin, eine adlige Offizierin, eine zwielichtige Kunsthändlerin und ein ehemaliger Gardist. Welche verworrenen Beziehungen pflegen die Gäste eigentlich untereinander? Hat es einer von ihnen eventuell sogar auf die anderen abgesehen? Das alles macht die Helden nicht nur unfreiwillig zu Detektiven in einer Künstlervilla voller kurioser Sammlerstücke, magischer Gegenstände, Spiegelkabinette und in Alkohol eingelegter Tiere. Es führt sie zusätzlich auf die Spur eines über 200 Jahre alten Geheimnisses. Eines, das mit Handwerkskunst zu tun hat, mit Magie – und mit Theater.

Stichworte zum Abenteuer: ein wertvoller Kunstgegenstand, eine mysteriöse Villa und viele Verdächtige
Genre: Detektivabenteuer
Voraussetzungen: Fähigkeit zur sozialen Interaktion,
Ermittlungsgespür und ein Faible für aventurisches Theater
Ort: Mirham
Zeit: 1043 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): mittel / hoch
Erfahrung (Helden): erfahren bis kompetent

Anforderungen:
Gesellschaftstalente xxxo
Wissenstalente xxxo
Handwerkstalente xooo
Lebendige Geschichte xooo

boardgame.name: Wolfsherz
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Die Nivesen: Seit Jahrtausenden ziehen sie als Nomaden ihren Karenherden durch Nordaventurien hinterher, sie trotzen Kälte und Wind und sie glauben an die Himmelswölfe. In ihrer schriftlosen Kultur wird alles Bewahrenswerte von Generation zu Generation durch mündliche Überlieferungen weitergegeben.
Nun führt ein Wolf die Helden in ein Nivesendorf, dessen Schamanin im Sterben liegt. Ihre letzten Worte wirken wie ein Vermächtnis und Hilfegesuch. Doch können sie diese Worte richtig deuten, den entstandenen Streit in der Sippe zu einer guten Entscheidung führen und gleichzeitig wichtiges Wissen für Aventurien bewahren?

Stichworte zum Abenteuer: Schamanismus, Konflikte um Tradition und Erneuerung in einer nivesischen Sippe, moralische Entscheidungen und ein Antagonist wider Willen
Genre: Gesellschaftsabenteuer in der Wildnis
Voraussetzungen: kältetaugliche Helden mit Interesse an der nivesischen Kultur sowie Sprache an sich
Ort: ein Winterlager einer Sippe der Hokke-Nivesen westlich der Gelben Sichel, Hoher Norden
Zeit: am Ende eines Winters ab 1043 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): niedrig / mittel
Erfahrung der Helden: erfahren bis kompetent

Anforderungen:
Gesellschaftstalente xxxx
Wissenstalente xxxo
Handwerkstalente xxoo
Lebendige Geschichte xooo
